channel.title: Starting from a 317 RENAMED Deob
channel.description:
[center][b]RENAMED![/b][/center]
[B][I]Changing your background:[/I][/B] Go into the Sprite class, search for: [CODE]Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);[/CODE] comment that out by putting two forward slashes in front of it. Above that, should look something similar but end with [I]mopar.jpg");[/I]. Change that line to this: [CODE]Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("cache/YOUR_IMAGE_NAME.gif");[/CODE] Be sure to change the [I]YOUR_IMAGE_NAME[/I] to the name of your image.
[B][I]Taking out the background flip: (THIS ALSO TAKES OUT THE RuneScape LOGO!)[/I][/B] Go into your client class, search for: [CODE]aRSImageProducer_1110.initDrawingArea();[/CODE] Directly above that, put a [I]/*[/I], this is a start of a comment. Next search for: [CODE]System.gc();[/CODE] Directly below that, put a [I]*/[/I], this ends your comment.
[B][I]Taking out the flames:[/I][/B] Go into your client class, go into the [I]calcFlamesPosition[/I] method. Right below the starting bracket, add [I]/*[/I], this is a start of a comment. Next search for: [CODE]anInt1041 = 1024;[/CODE] Right below that is a closing bracket, under that closing bracket add [I]*/[/I], this closes the comment.
[B][I]Changing the title:[/I][/B] Go into your Jframe class, inside the initUI method, replace "Jagex" with the title you want If you do not have a Jframe, go into your RSFrame class, and search for: [CODE]setTitle("Jagex");[/CODE] Change Jagex to whatever you want.
[B][I]Adding a theme to your client: (MUST ALREADY HAVE A Jframe)[/I][/B] [B][I]Downloads:[/I][/B] [URL=http://"http://www.mediafire.com/?zzinutmuzql"]Theme.jar[/URL]
[B][I]Tutorial:[/I][/B] First, put your Theme.jar into your cache folder. Now, in your Jframe class, in your initUI method, put this in: [CODE] UIManager .setLookAndFeel("org.jvnet.substance.skin.SubstanceOfficeBlue2007LookAndFeel"); JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true); JDialog.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true); [/CODE] Now, all you have to change is your [I]Launch.bat[/I], change it to [I]something like[/I] this: [CODE] @echo off title EternityX cd ../Bin java -cp .;"cache/Theme.jar" Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause [/CODE] You have to change that up a bit because I have my client setup in a certain way.
[B][I]How to change the theme:[/I][/B] To change the theme, run your client and in the top left corner, hit the java icon. Then go to your [I]Substance Skins[/I] and pick out something you like, for example you like the Magma theme, look in your Jframe class, inside the initUI method, change [CODE]SubstanceOfficeBlue2007LookAndFeel[/CODE] to [CODE]SubstanceMagmaLookAndFeel[/CODE]
[U][B][I]Enjoy, if you have any errors, feel free to ask me.[/I][/B][/U]

item.title: Starting from a 317 RENAMED Deob
item.dc:creator: @XxJtxX XxJtxX
item.description:
@XxJtxX wrote:

[center]RENAMED![/center]

Changing your background:
Go into the Sprite class, search for:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);

comment that out by putting two forward slashes in front of it. Above that, should look something similar but end with mopar.jpg");. Change that line to this:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("cache/YOUR_IMAGE_NAME.gif");

Be sure to change the YOUR_IMAGE_NAME to the name of your image.

Taking out the background flip: (THIS ALSO TAKES OUT THE RuneScape LOGO!)
Go into your client class, search for:

aRSImageProducer_1110.initDrawingArea();

Directly above that, put a /*, this is a start of a comment. Next search for:

System.gc();

Directly below that, put a */, this ends your comment.

Taking out the flames:
Go into your client class, go into the calcFlamesPosition method. Right below the starting bracket, add /*, this is a start of a comment. Next search for:

anInt1041 = 1024;

Right below that is a closing bracket, under that closing bracket add */, this closes the comment.

Changing the title:
Go into your Jframe class, inside the initUI method, replace “Jagex” with the title you want
If you do not have a Jframe, go into your RSFrame class, and search for:

setTitle("Jagex");

Change Jagex to whatever you want.

Adding a theme to your client: (MUST ALREADY HAVE A Jframe)
Downloads:
Theme.jar

Tutorial:
First, put your Theme.jar into your cache folder.
Now, in your Jframe class, in your initUI method, put this in:

			UIManager
					.setLookAndFeel("org.jvnet.substance.skin.SubstanceOfficeBlue2007LookAndFeel");
   			JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
   			JDialog.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

Now, all you have to change is your Launch.bat, change it to something like this:

@echo off
title EternityX
cd ../Bin
java -cp .;"cache/Theme.jar" Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

You have to change that up a bit because I have my client setup in a certain way.

How to change the theme:
To change the theme, run your client and in the top left corner, hit the java icon. Then go to your Substance Skins and pick out something you like, for example you like the Magma theme, look in your Jframe class, inside the initUI method, change

SubstanceOfficeBlue2007LookAndFeel

to

SubstanceMagmaLookAndFeel

Enjoy, if you have any errors, feel free to ask me.

Read full topic
